What is the structure of exercise 4?

Exercise 4 has two premises (1 and 2that lead to a conclusion (3), which then leads to another conclusion (4). Premise 5 contradicts the initial assumption, leading to a final conclusion (6). This is an example of a deductive argument.

Conclusion: No one living in Pompeii could have escaped before the lava from Mt. Vesuvius hit. 10. Explanation: When a person moves to Cincinnati, their allergies worsen. Exercise 4 1. 1.
